intro: Veronicastrum laciniatum, commonly known as blue mist spirea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces clusters of pale blue to lavender flowers in late summer. The plant has slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Veronicastrum laciniatum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
